Title: Provides that a default judgment against a defendant in a foreclosure action does not need to be vacated for such defendant to claim the plaintiff lacks standing or that the statute of limitations has expired
Summary: Provides that a default judgment against a defendant in a foreclosure action does not need to be vacated in order for the defense of lack of standing or expiration of the statute of limitations to be raised by the defendant.
LawSection: Real Property Actions and Proceedings Law
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the real property actions and proceedings law, in relation to clarifying that a default judgment against a defendant in a foreclosure action does not need to be vacated for such defendant to claim the plaintiff lacks standing or that the statute of limitations has expired
